definition[0]: used to refer to any person, when it is not important to say exactly who
example[1]: They offer help and advice to anyone interested in becoming a teacher.
example[2]: If anyone sees Lisa, ask her to call me.
example[3]: Anyone else who is interested in going on the trip should see me at the end of this lesson.
example[5]: Is there anyone new coming to tonight’s meeting?
example[6]: Do you know anyone else who wants a ticket?
definition[2]: used in negative sentences to mean no person
example[7]: I went to the bar but there wasn’t anyone there.
example[8]: I haven’t spoken to anyone all day.
explanation[0]: Anyone is written as one word in this meaning Don't write
explanation[1]: Any one of is usually written as separate words You usually write
example[10]: The same is true for any one of us
explanation[2]: You don't usually use of after anyone
definition[3]: used after mentioning something to ask whether people agree with you, especially about something you do not like
example[11]: I think people are dressing way too casually. I mean, shorts in the office, anyone?
